headline: Lentil and Sausage Soup
description: You'll love this hearty sausage and lentil soup in a rich tomato-based broth with lots of herbs for extra flavor. Serve with grated Romano cheese.
name: Lentil and Sausage Soup
recipeIngredient: 0.5 pound sweet Italian pork sausage, cut into 1/2-inch slices

recipeInstructions.text: Cook sausage in a large pot over medium-high heat until evenly brown, 7 to 10 minutes. Add onion, celery, and garlic; sauté until tender and translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in water, chicken broth, tomatoes, lentils, carrot, garlic powder, parsley, salt, pepper, oregano, thyme, basil, and bay leaves; bring to a boil. Reduce the heat, cover, and simmer until lentils are tender, 2 1/2 to 3 hours.
Stir in pasta and cook until tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Remove bay leaves before serving.

review.reviewBody: Lots of good nutrition with good fiber! Delicious flavor!

With all the ingredients, it ended up not fitting in my big stew pot, so then last minute I ended up pouring some out into another pot, and then finished adding the ingredients. Having two pots of the soup might have made the water levels interesting because it came out very dry. Super, super dry. For left overs I have been putting a ton of water in the microwavable bowl before heating it and that seems to soften the food, but not really create a soup texture.

Excellent soup! I used ground Italian sausage, all stock no water, and a little bit of smoked sea salt. Did not add pasta. We did add some crushed red pepper flakes to individual bowls which gave it a nice kick; may just used hot Italian sausage next time. Only cooked it about 2 hours and it was perfect.
Excellent lentil soup !!! I wouldn't change a single thing.

This lentil soup is delicious! Made it as directed and it was not difficult at all. Making it again tomorrow and will use hot Italian sausage rather than sweet for an added kick. Will eliminate the pasta (carbs).

This is hearty and very flavorful. Really enjoyed this one. I made it pretty much according to the recipe. I didn't have fresh parsley so went with dried. Used a can of whole tomatoes instead of diced. Used ground Italian Sausage (which I think made the broth even better). And went with about 10 cups of fluid, including chicken broth. And most importantly I only cooked it about an hour and a half. Just check the lentils and carrots every now and then until they're as you like them.
Been making this recipe for years now, always requested from my family for me to make again and again
My husband went nuts over this recipe. Will definitely make again!
We really loved this recipe. I doubled the sausage (not links, ground sausage) and dare I say that I may even triple it next time. I didn't add the add the pasta so I used 8 cups broth and no water.

Delicious! I used French green lentils (puy lentils) and after the initial veg sauté cooked it in my instant pot for 10 minute and 15 minutes natural release. I also had some mushrooms and zucchini that needed to be used, so tossed that in as well (prior to pressure cook). I only used about 1tsp of salt, but added some Tony Chachare's creole seasoning at the end.
Only change I made was I used sweet Italian chicken sausage. Can’t keep the neighbors from my door

I cooked this in the pressure cooker for 25 minutes at 15 lbs. pressure after browning the sausage in a skillet. I cooked the pasta separately and added it at the end. For the second batch, I doubled the dried herbs and reduced the salt to 1 tsp. I love it!
I uses 1/2 pound each hot and sweet vegan sausage, more celery and no carrots. It was delicious

This is a great recipe! I added twice the sausage, left out the celery, didn't have a Bay leaf, added more chicken broth compared to water and only simmered for 1 1/2 hours then added the ditilini which was a great addition. Very delicious and hearty !

Excellent recipe!! I used more chicken broth than the water. I can’t do onions so I used onion powder and flakes instead. Everything else I followed the recipe. Great flavor! I will definitely make this again!
I made it and it was fabulous. Instead of the pasta, which I couldn’t find, I added quick barley. Perfect cold weather soup.
Hearty and tasty. Accommodates different palates and easily adjusted with spices for personal preference. Family loved it.
Delicious! Was looking for something different for my Italian New Years Day lentils! I made the recipe exactly as written except I substituted cubed sweet potato for the pasta, came out great !

Overall this is a good recipe, with tweaks. I used Chicken sausage, which lightens it up. I used 4 cups of chicken stock and only 2 cups of water, since I added the juices from the diced tomatoes. I used smaller chunks of sausage, removed them after browning, adding them after the lentils , etc. I cooked it on the stovetop for about 1 hr or so and its perfect consistency. Ill make it again.

Excellent! I did tweak it a little. Adding more meat & garlic & less liquid & less lintels, nothing too drastic. My husband and I love it and we will make it again and again. Thank you for sharing this wonderful recipe.

This is a really good BASE. It's not spicy at all if that's what you're shooting for.
I started experimenting with it and added a little smoked paprika. It works beautifully with this base and gives it a much needed boost of flavor without adding much in the way of spicy heat. If you want a spicy dish, this could use hot Italian sausage instead of sweet. 
 I gave it 3 stars because it's really not complete. It's woefully underspiced, and needs a lot of work. But it is a really good base for a new soup if someone wants to try something new and creative.
Easy, a little frank hot sauce made it even more tastes
It was just ok. I don't particularly care for lentils, but this was actually the best recipes I've found.
Love this soup. Recipe makes a ton of portions. Great for a cold day.
I made it in the Instant pot and it was a great success......spicy and rich.
Delicious and easy recipe! Did not use celery as we don't care for cooked celery but otherwise made exactly as written. So good and we will definitely make again!

I pretty much used all of the ingredients in the recipe except I had some left-over breakfast sausage that I used instead of the sausage suggested. It had a good flavor and texture - although I didn't need to cook the lentils as long as directed. I must have had a different kind as they are done in about 30 min. All in all it was very tasty and I would make it again!

This was amazing and I will be making again! It fed us for days. This is a great recipe that you can use whatever ingredients you have on hand. I only use jarred Garlic so that's what I used here, I didn't have celery, I cut the carrots into rounds because I love big chunks of carrots in my soups and stews, I used a mixture of organic chicken and turkey bone broth because I cannot have regular broths due to migraines, I doubled all the seasonings. I had to add a lot more liquid than the recipe called for. I just kept adding water as it boiled down. I'm very happy with this recipe!
Easy and delicious!
My soup may not being the prettiest but please believe when I tell you it’s amazing! I added some cummin along side everything else

Made in Dutch Oven. Very good soup! Altered recipe a bit. Used chorizo sausage instead of Italian. Added another stalk of celery and only used 8oz or half bag of lentils (all I had at time). Only used 6 cups of water due to less lentils but added package of onion soup mix I had to water. Added dash of cumin and 1/4 teaspoon of crushed red pepper for extra spice. Lastly, instead of tube pasta, used 2/3 cup of elbow pasta and turned out fine.
Very yummy! used salt as needed instead of what's in the recipe like others recommended to do.
Delicious! It was very flavorful and my family enjoyed it

Our family loved this recipe I’m shocked because my husband even loved it and he doesn’t like anything! The differences I made were as follows... I used vegan sausages instead of real sausage, crushed tomatoes instead of the diced and at the end I added a can of white beans and a few handfuls of spinach to bulk it up even more. Great recipe!
I made a modified version - Lentil Pepperoni
I love tomatoes in soup so I added a can of tomato sauce ( 15 oz) as well as add a bit more sausage. I was delicious and I will definitely be making this again and again!
I will definitely make again
add more sausage to 1.5 pds and only a cup of pasta..
Delicious. Used a little more sausage, no pasta and no bay leaves.
This was an immediate favorite! Never the same twice, I used fresh herbs nearly every time, but even with dried ones, never a complaint!
Delicious! I made 2 batches....one as written, one without the tomatoes and pasta and I used all broth. Both were absolutely amazing. What a nice, healthy soup
made it in instant pot; Sauté until onions translucent then cooked on high pressure setting for only 10min and quick release.

Wonderful! My package of sausage was a little over a pound, so I thought I'd double the recipe, until I saw how much water and broth it called for. So I doubled the meat and veggies, but not the lentils and fluids. It almost filled my 6 qt. InstaPot (I used Saute and Slow Cooker options). I had grated Parmesan cheese (not the powdery stuff) and it worked great on top of the soup. I realized the next day that I forgot the pasta. I never missed it.

First of all I made this soup in my crock pot and second I had no celery or carrots or thyme or onion. I used onion powder. I added 4 cups of water and 2 boxes of chicken broth to the cooker. Then I added cut up sausage. I added bay leaves and rinsed off lentils.. I let simmer on high for about two hours then added the seasonings and tomatoes. Last I added orzo because I didn't have ditalini. I'm proud of how this soup turned out since I've never eaten lentil soup or made it before!
added a few chopped green olives

This was delicious! We added a bit of grated Parmesan reggiano and some hot pepper flakes. It was a little more time consuming than I initially planned for, but it was so worth it!. I will definitely be making this recipe again!
Doubled sausage
I used hot Italian sausage, added a teaspoon of red pepper flakes and a few dashes of Cholula sauce.
Absolutely delicious! Even better than anticipated. Shared the leftovers with my mom. She called elated by the taste. A keeper for certain!

My son and husband really liked it but a 4 rather than 5 stars, my husband says, because he would've liked it more with pork sausage (i used sweet italian chicken sausage). I added more broth and less water. I doubled the sausage as many others did. After browning the sausage and veggies on the pan, I threw everything into the crockpot for 4 hours, minus the tomatoes until the last hour. I didn't have parsley. I didn't do pasta as family trying to cut back on carbs. I added extra seasoning. I didn't sprinkle with cheese and I think they would have liked that. Thank you so much for the recipe!
pretty darn good! this recipe makes enough to feed a small army, you could probably feed the whole family if you 1/2 it.
Thanks for a great recipe! Loved the sausage!
I made this soup using 3/4 lb green onion pork sausage. I added 2 tsp cumin and 2 tsp sweet curry to give it an extra flavor boost. Got rave reviews and will be making this again.

I made this soup and it was really very good (but gassy, lentils?). I made it in the crock pot, was super easy. I did substitute pepperoni for the sausage. My husband's mom used to do that so I wanted to do that for him. He loved it!

Wonderful soup full of delicious flavors! I made this several years ago and could not find the recipe. Luckily, I went into my Allrecipes recipe box and found it. I will make it again this winter. Such a hearty meal!

As with most soups with sausage I think much of the flavor has to do with the flavor of the sausage you start with since it imparts so much to the broth. I ended up having to add a significant amount of Italian seasoning, rosemary, and red pepper flakes to get this soup up to par. I cut the water back by 2 cups, doubled the sausage, chopped the carrots instead of shredding as many suggested, and ended up adding a can of tomato sauce to bulk up the broth. The lentils cooked far more slowly than did the pasta so by the time the soup was ready the pasta had disintegrated. All of that being said, I did follow the basic recipe and my family loved it.
Good. With the sausage makes a meal, but I prefer a veggie lentil soup.
MADE THIS DELICIOUS MEAL. EVERYONE THOUGHT " OH LENTILS UGH" WELL THEY ALL LIKED IT AND WENT BACK FOR SECONDS. OH YEAH THEY TOOK IT FOR LUNCH TOO.
Made this soup following the directions and it was delicious. All I added was crusty Italian bread. I have had numerous request for the recipe.
delicious! used 5 carrots sliced rather than grated. 1 pkg of sausages. skipped celery. ~250g of lentils. 5xgarlic cloves. dry basil, oregano, salt, pepper, cayenne pepper for a bit of spice.

Excellent recipe. I doubled the amount of sausage, used two stalks of celery, and added a bag of fresh spinach that I chopped up before adding to the pot. I followed the rest of the recipe as written. I will make this again and again.

Good! Not Carrara’s lentil soup good but delicious nonetheless. I followed the recipe exactly but used hot Italian sausage and added some red pepper flakes/cayenne. As good as you’re going to get! And this made a ton so I froze a lot and we will eat it again in the future
Family approved. My husband says the seasoning were on point and was better than his favorite place. Looks like we are saving money this winter.
The family really enjoyed this soup. It makes a ton and is very filling.

Very flavorful! Did not add pasta though due to the soup appearing pretty thick already. Didn’t want the pasta to absorb all the liquid. I used all chicken broth. (9 3/4 Cups total). 1 lb. Italian Sausage, and 14 ozs. Of lentils was plenty.

I made this with turkey Italian sausage, omitted the salt and added red pepper flakes for extra zing. Otherwise, I left everything else the same. It also didn't require the 3 hour cooking time. Delicious, even on a hot summer day.
I don’t like too much tomatoe sauce. And add some extra spices, otherwise very good.

Set aside enough time (3 hours) to make this delicious soup. It is worth it, and extras can be frozen. I made the pasta separately, so that it wouldn’t absorb the remaining liquid and soften. I added some baby spinach and grated Parmigiano Reggiano and Romano cheese at the end, as well as some crushed red pepper for a little heat. Delicious!
This was the best soup I have ever had. I used spicy Italian sausage instead of sweet and it added a nice flavor.
This soup was very close to Carraba’s. Love it and so did my hubby. Will definitely make again!
This soup is one of my go-tos when I need something filling and warm.

I used a full pound of sausage, cut back on water and added more tomatoes. I used two ribs of celery and added a finely chopped carrot. I also left the cilantro out because we have one guest who hates the taste. We added it to part of the batch. 

It was great the first time and the leftovers were even better.
I added a can of drained chickpeas. It was so good.

Delicious. The only change I made is chicken broth instead of the water and I used a bit less lentils than what it calls for. I used green lentils and they were cooked in about 1 hr at very low heat. This recipe yields a lot!

I skipped the salt and reduced the chicken stock, added a bit more tin tomatoes than the recipe. I thought it was a bit salty still but my hubby and the youngest daughter really liked it. I liked it as well but maybe a little less chicken stock next time. Over all, very hearty and delicious soup that's prefect for the frigid weather that we are having this winter.
Added more carrots and celery, full pound of sausage, only let it cook for about an hour or so and it's still great

my family Loved it. Even my picky eater said please make again. Made it almost as written, but sausage doubled only because I was lazy and didn't separate pkg to half lb. wouldn't have mattered. so yummy and total comfort food. did top off each bowl with a decent reggiano (only cuz I had on hand, rare), very nice touch but not necessary for the "this is a winner" category at home. I wasn't excited about shredding the carrot but did it with a hand grater (would have taken longer with finding parts of food processer thing that in my house requires cleaning both before and after). I liked the shredded carrot in it. this is going into not only soup/lunch mix, but dinner too, and to bring to family. (I did not add the pasta)
I used beef broth instead of chicken broth. Add pepper flakes.

My Husband loves Carrabba’s Lentil and Sausage soup so when I came across this recipe, I knew that I had to make it. It was really easy to prepare. Instead of the Italian sausage, I used chicken chorizo sausage and I didn’t use any water, only chicken bone stock. My whole family enjoyed it

This was the perfect recipe to introduce me to cooking with Lentils. I used the full lb of Italian sausage instead of 1/2 (it would've gone to waste) and I omitted the carrots because my family is full of picky eaters. They loved it!

I love lentils and usually just cook them with garlic, celery and onions. This soup was a definite keeper. Followed the recipe Exactly except ,used turkey sausage. Definitely will make It again but maybe spice it up a bit with red pepper flakes.
This soup was so flavorful! It is perfect for a rainy day when your soul needs a little pick me up. I will be making it again...
Really good
I didn't have any celery, but I followed the recipe exactly other than that. My husband said it was great, and he's fussy about his soup! I will be making this again.
The first time I make a recipe, I follow it with no changes. This is a great recipe. The next time I am going to use more spices.
I left out the celery and used orzo instead of ditalini pasta. Delicious and hearty soup!
I used a meatless Italian sausage made by Tofurkey. It worked beautifully. I sliced 3 sausages thinly before browning them in the skillet.

Yummy! This is my first review after years of trying recipes from Allrecipes. I thought this soup was good. Like others, I increased the amount of sausage, and used both hot and sweet Italian sausage. I'm perplexed by the reviewer that could only taste sausage... I think the herbs, spices and seasoning were fantastic and flavourful. I used an immersions blender to thicken it a bit, and also tried the addition of a tater tot (as recommended on the site) when I reheated a single portion today. So good. And pretty healthy in the big scheme of things: lots of fibre and protein. Will definitely make again.
I thought this would make a ton so I halved the ingredients. Turned out great. I used orzo for the pasta which soaked up a lot of the broth so I'll need to add more to the leftovers when I re-heat.
Easy recipe and so delicious! Even better the next day!
I chose to double up on the sausage , try it !
The lentils fell apart and became mushy and unrecognizable. The recipe needed some additional flavors. I added rotel tomatoes and corn. We enjoyed the meal but it was not recognizable.
Great hearty and healthy. Even better reheated! Yum!

Wonderful soup! Based on reviews I decided to modify it a little by reducing the water to 5 cups and increasing chicken broth to 32 ounces. I added a whole pound of Italian sausage and am glad I did. I only put in one teaspoon of salt and no pasta. The whole family loved it, even my picky kids.
This recipe brought me back to my childhood. I did modify it a little by adding chicken sausage but everything else was spot on.
this was probably the best soup I have ever made. I did use 1lb of Italian sausage
I would suggest making the pasta on the side and adding since my soup was quite thick.
Made it as written, except I used Italian seasoned canned tomatoes instead of regular and omitted the spices (except garlic, salt, pepper). Very tasty, and the family loved it.
Just Okay
